intro: Apodytes dimidiata var. emirnensis, commonly known as the Emirnensis sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated for its attractive foliage and flowering display.
